question: Has the person been:
choices: finally judged by a Member State in respect of the same acts
being prosecuted in the Executing Member State for the same act
been finally judged by a third State in respect of the same acts

question: Does any of the following apply to proceeding taking place in the issuing Mmeber State?
choices: the person has been made aware of the trial
was informed that a decision may be handed down if he or she does not appear for the trial

had given a mandate to a legal counsellor, who was either appointed by the person concerned or by the State, to defend him or her at the trial, and was indeed defended by that counsellor at the trial;
being expressly informed about the right to a retrial
expressly stated that he or she does not contest the decision
did not request a retrial or appeal within the applicable time frame
was not personally served with the decision

will be personally served with it without delay after the surrender and will be expressly informed of his or her right to a retrial, or an appeal, in which the person has the right to participate and which allows the merits of the case, including fresh evidence, to be re-examined, and which may lead to the original decision being reversed
will be informed of the time frame within which he or she has to request such a retrial or appeal

question: the offence on the basis of which the European arrest warrant has been issued is punishable by custodial life sentence or life-time detention order
Is the execution of the EIO contrary to the principle of ne bis in idem?
